definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
to fulfill one's duty/to work without asking for reward
National Tree Planting Day (March 12th), as known as Arbor Day 植樹節|植树节[Zhi2 shu4 jie2]
pinyin: Quan2 min2 Yi4 wu4 Zhi2 shu4 ri4

sentences.english: Popularization of compulsory pre-school education should be given priority.
sentences.chinese: 义务教育应优先提高学前教育。

sentences.english: Individual families should be responsible for the cleanliness of their own units.
sentences.chinese: 每个家庭都有义务清洁他们自己的居住单元。

sentences.english: Obligation followed is a very living factor in the space of contract world.
sentences.chinese: 附随义务是合同世界里十分活跃的因素。

sentences.english: The second chapter represents the basic fiduciary duties of the plan trustees.
sentences.chinese: 第二章是美国员工持股计划受托人的基本信义义务。

sentences.english: Keeping the law is a legal obligation and moral requirement which manifests as the law-abiding action.
sentences.chinese: 守法是一种法定的义务和道德要求。

sentences.english: This is the commitment of Damanhur for the future.
sentences.chinese: 这就是达曼胡尔对未来承担的义务。

sentences.english: Nor would we undertake an obligation to concert US-Soviet actions toward third countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们也不承担协调美苏针对第三国行动的义务。

sentences.english: Everyone has the obligation to ponder well his own specific traits of character.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都有义务考虑自己的性格特征。

sentences.english: The customs may publish the failure of taxpayers to pay duty.
sentences.chinese: 海关可以对纳税义务人欠缴税款的情况予以公告。

sentences.english: So the citizen has the obligation to obey such good law.
sentences.chinese: 对于这样的良法，公民就有遵守的义务。

sentences.english: However, the assignor may be liable to the obligor for breach of contract.
sentences.chinese: 但是，让与人可能因而向债务人承担违约义务。

sentences.english: The joint co-owners shall undertake the rights and obligations with respect to the property under co-ownership.
sentences.chinese: 共同共有人对共有财产享有权利，承担义务。

sentences.english: Never desert a group to which you owe your support.
sentences.chinese: 不要背弃自己必须尽义务支持的团体。

sentences.english: We not only have the training, but the obligation, on or off duty.
sentences.chinese: 我们不仅有训练，也有义务，即使下班时间。

sentences.english: Here you have every right, and perhaps an obligation, to toot your own horn and be a bit egotistical.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题上，你有权利或者是义务来自吹自擂。

sentences.english: No one is bound to accuse himself except to God.
sentences.chinese: 任何人无指控自己的义务，但面对上帝时不在此限。

definition: to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
to fulfill one's duty/to work without asking for reward
right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
to have the right to/to be entitled to/to have authority/powerful
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
